item.title: 32-bit application support in RHEL7
item.description: I recently needed to check the supportability of 32-bit applications in Red Hat Enterprise Linux. RHEL can support 32-bit applications in a 64-bit environment in the following scenarios: https://access.redhat.com/solutions/509373 Additionally, with the multilib toolchain, one can install the 32-bit packages by specifying the architecture in the yum install command:

item.title: Google Chrome on RHEL/CentOS 6+
item.description: So if you’re like me and like to run the same OS on your desktop that is in your data centre, you might have come across the problem of Google Chrome support being discontinued for Red Hat 6+ and its clones.Â Thankfully there’s a script developed by Richard Lloyd that will automatically download and install the latest Google Chrome browser for you.
